name: Engineers Serving the Community
description:
Engineers Serving the Community desires to improve the Texas A&M Campus and support the surrounding community through the application of engineering design skills. On top of working to improve campus sustainability and safety, ESC seeks to use engineering skills to support local charity organizations (Brazos Valley Food Bank, Humane Society) and individuals in need. Please join our Facebook group for up to date information.

Our general meetings are held on the first Thursday of the month in CVE 110 at 7 p.m.

Through both Texas A&M and local institutions, we receive many projects requiring a wide variety of engineering disciplines.

Active Projects

  • Aggie Registration Assistance App — Creating an app that assists in course registration by providing a graphical aid similar to prior myEdu services

Project Leads: Kellie Meredith (kelliem2001@tamu.edu) and George Gaytan (gsgaytan@tamu.edu)
Status: Programming

  • Brazos Valley Fair Water Conservation Interactive Display — designing an interactive display that educates children about water conservation, hydrologic cycle, and the impact we have on the environment

Project Lead: Brianna Rose (rosebri12@tamu.edu) and Mason Herpin (mcherpin@tamu.edu) 
Status: Prototyping and Production

  • Corps of Cadets March of Dimes Bridge — Building a bridge to be used by the corps for the March to the Brazos

Project Lead: Kensley Humphrey (kensley@tamu.edu)
Status: Designing

  • Pickard Passageway — Investigating safety concerns and proposing possible solutions

Project Lead: George Gillette (gillette1995@tamu.edu)
Status: Pitching Reccomendations

  • Skateboard/Longboard Racks —  designing and manufacturing skateboard racks for Texas A&M campus

Project Lead: Paul Baker (paulb000x@tamu.edu)
Status: Constructing prototypes

  • Zachary Green Roof — Constructing a green roof for the new engineering building

Project Lead: Sonja Loy (sonjaloy@tamu.edu)
Status: Proposals and funding for design

  • Passive Dew Harvesting — Connection with local non-profit organizations to test various chemical treatments for passive dew harvesting to relieve water stress in developing parts of the world

Developing Projects

  • San Antonio Food Bank — Developing on-going partnership for projects such as a seal checking device, inventory optimization, and general engineering consulting

Past Projects

  • Aggie Fix-it — Creating an app to assist in Texas A&M University campus maintenance by allowing geo-located public reporting of issues

Project Leads: Kellie Meredith and George Gaytan

  • Brazos Valley Food Bank — Designed sanitation sorting tables and fixed energy draining ventilation leak

Project Lead: Emily Burch

  • Solar Lighted Sign — Optimizing solar configuration and finding energy parameters of solar panels for current and future lighted sign designs

Project Lead: Justin Lewis

  • Playground Music Wall — Designing musical instruments out of playground materials which were then implemented on a local church's playground that ESC had previously constructed

Project Lead: Mason Herpin

  • Wheelchair Ramp — Designed and built a wheelchair ramp for a local resident
summary: Engineers Serving the Community desires to improve the Texas A&M Campus and support the surrounding community through the application of engineering design skills.
